page.title: 02LANGUAGE
page.content: The language is a form of Doric. Below is a paragraph written in doric . My faither's a fairmer aside Huntly Aiberdeenshire.The gruns is maistly used for crap's, bit we hiv a curn o' beasts _ aboot fifty nout an' ae ewie as weel. Theres a pair o'horse, ane gey near deen, and the ither aboot fower year aul; bit wi 'a' the new machinery they hinna tae dee ony wark. BELOW IS AN ENGLISH TRANSLATION My father is a farmer beside Huntly in Aberdeenshire.The land is chiefly used for crops,but we have a few animals-about fifty cattle and a sheep as well.There is a pair of horses,one rather past its best and the other about four years old,but with all the new machinery they do not have to do any work.
